oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ray Whitley home recordings - 1941
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Various home recordings from Ray Whitley, including messages to his wife Kay Whitley, his daughter Judy Kay, and Fred and Lorene Rose. Recordings are from the years 1941, 1942, 1943, 1945, and 1949
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Whitley; Fred Rose; Oklahoma Wranglers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ray Whitley gives a message of well-wishes to Kay Whitley, along with Fred Rose, Lorene Rose, Ken Card, Jesse Ashlock, and other friends and family members, during Thanksgiving of 1942 -- (02:49) Fred and Lorene Rose give a message of well-wishes to Ray and Kay Whitley, during late-1943 -- (05:45) Fred and Lorene Rose gives a message of well-wishes to the Whitleys -- (08:40) Ray Whitley introduces the tune -- Old MacDonald Had A Farm (Ray Whitley, various) (incomplete) -- (10:32) Ray Whitley, Fred Rose, and members of the Oklahoma Wranglers give a message of well-wishes to Kay and Judy Kay Whitley, in late 1945 -- (13:20) Roundup In The Sky (Ray Whitley, Fred Rose, Oklahoma Wranglers) [unconfirmed] -- (15:15) Lee "Lasses" White gives Ray and Kay Whitley a message of well-wishes and sings an unidentified tune, in 1941 when Kay was expecting the birth of their daughter Judy Kay
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Whitley, Ray; Whitley, Kay; Rose, Fred; Rose, Fred, 1897-1954; Card, Ken, 1912-1990; Oklahoma Wranglers (Musical group); Ashlock, Jesse, 1915-1976; Ashlock, Jesse;
